title: 3 Ways to Advertise a Garage Sale on Facebook on PC or Mac

steps.title: Log into your Facebook account.
steps.content: Log into your Facebook account. If needed, you can reset it .

steps.title: Click on Events from your newsfeed page.
steps.content: Click on Events from your newsfeed page. This will be listed on the left side of the screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Add a cover photo.
steps.content: Add a cover photo. Click the top of the page to upload a photo. Be sure to upload a photo of your garage or lawn with most of your items in view; this will be the image people see. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Enter an event name.
steps.content: Enter an event name. Use a name such as Garage sale , Yard sale , or Moving sale .

steps.title: Enter a start date and time.
steps.content: Enter a start date and time. Click the field for each and select a date and time for your garage sale.

steps.title: Fill in additional details.
steps.content: Fill in additional details. Click the Is it in person or virtual field and select In person . Click Who can see it? and select Public to ensure your event reaches as many people as possible. Click What are the details? field and enter additional details that can help potential buyers, such as location help, active hours, unique/rare items, etc.

steps.title: Click Create event.
steps.content: Click Create event . This is the blue button at the bottom of the window. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Share button to advertise it.
steps.content: Click the Share button to advertise it. You can share this event with friends, via messenger, or publish it as a post . If you have other social media accounts, consider posting your event link on those platforms for more views. Ask friends and family to pass along your event. You can pay for traditional advertising by clicking Promote Event at the top. This will allow you to pay for time to promote the visibility of your garage sale across Facebook.

steps.title: Log into your Facebook account.
steps.content: Log into your Facebook account. If you don't have an account, you'll need to make one.

steps.title: Click What's on your mind?.
steps.content: Click What's on your mind? . A pop-up window will open. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Enter your details.
steps.content: Enter your details. Include Garage Sale at the top of your post along with your address, date, and time of the event. Below that, enter additional details that can help potential buyers, such as location help, active hours, unique/rare items, etc.

steps.title: Add pictures.
steps.content: Add pictures. Click the Photo/video icon to upload. Be sure to upload a photo of your garage or lawn with most of your items in view; this will be the image people see.

steps.title: Set the audience.
steps.content: Set the audience. Click Only me and select Public to ensure your event reaches as many people as possible.

steps.title: Tap Post.
steps.content: Tap Post . This is the blue button on the bottom. Your status will be posted. [6] X Research source Try tagging friends to promote your garage sale.

steps.title: Log into your Facebook account.
steps.content: Log into your Facebook account. If you don't have an account, you can create one . Keep in mind that Facebook may take down listings that advertise yard sales rather than individual items.

steps.title: Click Marketplace from your newsfeed.
steps.content: Click Marketplace from your newsfeed. It's located on the left side of the page. You can also click the shop icon at the top of the page. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click + Create new listing.
steps.content: Click + Create new listing . You can find this on the left side of the page. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Item for Sale.
steps.content: Click Item for Sale . Since Facebook Marketplace no longer has a Garage Sale category, you'll need to advertise your garage sale using the regular item listing.

steps.title: Click Add Photos to add photos.
steps.content: Click Add Photos to add photos. Take a good photo of your garage or lawn with most of your items in view; this will be the first image people see. You'll have a total of 10 slots to showcase your items for sale. [9] X Research source If you have a lot of items spread around, you can also take a video. Click Add Video to upload the video.

steps.title: Add in your details.
steps.content: Add in your details. You can be as descriptive as you want. [10] X Research source Title : Use a title such as Garage sale , Yard sale , or Moving sale . Optional: Put your address in the title along with the date (x/x/2023 or TODAY) Price : Enter an amount close to the average price of your items. You can also simply put $1 or $0 . Category : Select a category that matches the majority of your items, or Miscellaneous . More Details : Enter your address and date/time of the sale first. Then, enter any details that can help potential buyers, such as location help, active hours, unique/rare items, etc. If you don't see this field, click More Details .

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next . This will be at the bottom of the left panel. [11] X Research source You'll need to finalize your listing.

steps.title: Tap "Delivery method" and select Local pickup only.
steps.content: Tap "Delivery method" and select Local pickup only . This will ensure that people know you won't be shipping any items out.

steps.title: Click Publish.
steps.content: Click Publish . Your Facebook Marketplace listing will be published. [12] X Research source Be sure to keep an eye on your messages in case any potential buyers want to contact you beforehand.
